projectPurpose: To provide a self-hosted, open-source AI coding assistant that serves as a privacy-focused and on-premises alternative to cloud-based AI coding tools, offering features like code completion, chat, and code assistance with full control over data and infrastructure.
mainFeatures: Self-contained (no external DBMS or cloud required)

alternatives.name: GitHub Copilot
mainFeatures: Supports a wide range of languages

alternatives.name: Amazon CodeWhisperer (part of Amazon Q Developer)
alternatives.license: Proprietary (Free tier for individuals, Paid for organizations)
mainFeatures: Suggestions based on code and comments

alternatives.name: Tabnine
alternatives.license: Proprietary (Free, Pro, Enterprise - Enterprise includes on-premises)

alternatives.name: Continue
mainFeatures: Chat to understand and iterate on code

marketPositioning: Tabby is positioned as a leading open-source and self-hosted AI coding assistant, offering a strong alternative to proprietary cloud-based tools like GitHub Copilot and Amazon CodeWhisperer. Its core value proposition lies in providing developers and organizations with privacy, security, and data control by enabling them to run the AI models on their own infrastructure. It competes in the self-hosted segment against offerings like Tabnine Enterprise and other open-source assistants, differentiating itself through its self-contained architecture and focus on easy integration with existing development environments.
